text:
Modification of the Northern Ireland (St Andrews Agreement) Act 2006
	The Northern Ireland (St Andrews Agreement) Act [2006 (c.53)](/id/ukpga/2006/53?view=plain "Go to item of legislation") shall haveeffect, and shall be deemed always to have had effect, as if—
		each reference in the Act to 25 March 2007 were a reference to 7 May 2007,
		each reference in the Act to 26 March 2007 were a reference to 8 May 2007,
		the reference in the Act to 27 March 2007 were a reference to 9 May 2007,and
		each reference in the Act to 28 March 2007 were a reference to 10 May 2007.
	Accordingly, in particular,—
		the order made by the Secretary of State on 25 March 2007 by virtue ofsection 2(2) of the Act shall be deemed not to have been made (and theNorthern Ireland Act 2000 (Suspension of Devolved Government) Order 2002([S.I. 2002/2574](/id/uksi/2002/2574?view=plain "Go to item of legislation"))shall be deemed not to have been revoked),
		Part 2 (including Schedules 5 to 7) of the Act and Schedule 2 to the Act(and the amendments and repeals made by those provisions) shall be deemed notto have come into force on 26 March 2007,
		section 1(1)(b) of the Act (purpose of the Transitional Assembly) shallhave effect subject to the modifications in subsection (1) above,
		any order made by the Secretary of State on 27 March 2007 by virtue ofsection 2(3) of the Act shall be deemed not to have been made, and
		Schedule 3 to the Act (and the amendments and repeals made by it) shall bedeemed not to come into force (or not to have come into force) on 28 March2007 (and section 21 of the Act, and the amendments made by it, shall haveeffect accordingly).
Short title
	This Act may be cited as the Northern Ireland (St Andrews Agreement) Act 2007.
